targets: The Russ College of Engineering and Technology has been the benfactor of a $124 million gift from the Russ Family.  We utilize those funds to offer additional scholarships beyond what Ohio University provides to students. The scholarships are based generally upon ACT score and high school GPA.
98% of all Russ College students are either employed in their technical field or are enrolled in graduate school within 6 months of graduation.

Students in a learning community take a common set of courses which allows them to create peer networks which help improve student success and retention in the college.  In addtion, the students interact with a faculty member in a relaxed setting allowing for mentorship and trust to be established with the students.

The Russ College of Engineering and Technology has been the benfactor of a $124 million gift from the Russ Family.  We utilize those funds to offer funding for undergraduates to conduct research one-on-one with any faculty member in the Russ College.  The funding is available every semester for as long as the student is enrolled in the Russ College.

There are several majors which conduct research in health care; chemical engineering in cancer research, mechanical engineering in prosthetics and bone research; and industrial and sytems engineering in health care logistics.

Every semester our undergraduate students can apply for undergraduate research funds to work one-on-one with a faculty member.  In addition, many of our students have paid internships or part-time employment in our research faculty labs.
